Por favor su oportuna ayuda. He respaldado mis marcadores, así que si es necesario reiniciar mi cuenta o algo por el estilo, estoy dispuesto a hacerlo (en caso de que eso agilite el proceso.

Quedo atento!

Saludos cordiales,

title: places.sqlite always corrupting when opening Firefox
content:
Prior to today, occasionally I would need to restore from a Time Machine backup the files "places.sqlite", "places.sqlite-shm", and "places.sqlite-wal" into my default profile, because I would lose my bookmarks & history.

However, beginning this morning, that procedure did not work. Every time I open up Firefox, the "places.sqlite" file would corrupt immediately and no attempt at restoring (from any backup date/time) would fix the issue.

I am running Mac OS 11.7.2 (Big Sur) and Firefox 111.0.

This is VERY frustrating, because I rely heavily on my bookmarks and passwords.

PLEASE HELP!!!!!!
creator: rscott1

title: Firefox only Twitter Something went wrong, but don’t fret — it’s not your fault.
content:
Hi:

This happens all of the sudden. Whenever I click on # or search anything in Twitter , this message "Something went wrong, but don’t fret — it’s not your fault." comes up with no result returns. It only happens in Firefox, tested with other broswers , no problem. I tested it with Firefox 102 , 108 and 110, happens in all, but if I replaced the pref.js file with a newly created one (from create a new profile) , this problem and "Secure Connection Failed" problem with some of the sites are gone, so there is something in the pref.js file that is causing these two problems. I have uninstalled all extensions and browse in "troubleshoot mode" , the problems still appear.

I have not installed any new extension or applications.

I have removed entries in firewall and let the firewall "re-learn". I tried to compare (manually and using software) the two pref.js files (newly created and the problematic one) , but the list is long in the problematic one.

Not sure if the two above mentioned problems are related to the same cause. The virus / adware scans did not find anything. Any suggestions?
creator: HeavenlyFox

title: Failed update
content: Running on Windows 10. Got message that new version was available and clicked download download. Exited Firefox. A few minutes later, I clicked the Firefox icon in the menu. I got a full screen gray box with a few shadow lines that would probably be menu bars. No images showing. Repeatedly get "Firefox is not responding" with close Firefox or wait. I click wait and nothing happens. It has a spinning progress icon but no activity. Task manager shows 0% CPU, Disk and network, and 10.1MB Memory. I rebooted the computer and get the same result when restarting Firefox. I suspect a bad image was downloaded that corrupted Firefox and I don't know how to recover. I hope to be able to access the tabs I had open before the update. Any suggestions? Thanks Richard Flowers

title: "Generate secure passwords" seems to be increasingly broken and unuseable
content: This feature was great when it was first implemented but it seems to be increasingly unusable. It flatly refuses to generate passwords on many sites seemingly because there is a flag set in the textbox's code disabling auto-complete. It won't allow you to customize the types of passwords that are generated e.g. length, complexity, excluded characters, etc. This wouldn't be such an issue if there was a way to manually generate a password but there seems to be no tool for this anywhere in the settings and no plans to add this feature. I wouldn't be so frustrated if I didn't actually like and actually use the password manager but I do. I rely upon it almost daily and it is extremely disheartening to see it repeatedly confounded by poor design and implementation.
creator: leonardchurch33

title: ask before closing one tab/window firefox
content:
Is there anyway to get Firefox to warn me before closing a window? As in: Having ONLY one tab open will still require a prompt before closing. This may not seem like a big issue, and really it isn't, but I have my browser setup to clear all data upon closing, and use various other privacy options and 2-factor authenticators make singing in, should I accidentally close my window, slightly annoying to have to go through. title: Firefox takes a long time to resolve first website, but is fine after that
content:
We are using firefox on Redhat 7 workstations and, when we first open firefox and attempt to load a web address it takes 15-20 seconds to connect.

After that first attempt, web addresses load almost instantly.

Our systems are only connected to a local network and not the internet, if that makes a difference. Also, we are using web addresses and not IP addresses. When I try by Ip address it's much faster, but I get the security risk warning for the ssl cert. So I'm not sure if my issue is something between firefox and dns, or if it has to do with the SSL certs? Both dns and ssl are handled by Red Hat IDM.

We are seeing the same behavior on all of our workstations.

title: Firefox version higher than 78 will lock up on linux host running on cloud instance t
content:
bold textLinux Instance runnning in AWS locks up with firefox version higher than 78. Cyberark does use Xming aplication brokering. I logon to linux instance and type firefox and the page will lockup and I can't type anything in the browser. I have tried different options listed under your support page and ran many search related X11 slowness with firefox and nothing fixes the issue. Is there a bug with a specific version of Xming when using firefox? I have tried shutting down any McAfee services and the following options. Uncheck hardware acceleration about:config gfx.webrender.all set to true, browser.session.restore_on_demand to false, browser.session.restore_tabs_lazily to false and the browser does not lock, but once enter the web page it locks up.

Example when I use Red Hat Satellite , it locks up and had to kill the firefox process . When I add the options above I can get into the web page like satellite, logon etc. but then it locks. I need fire fox to work on a cloud instance that does use Xming since that is what CyberArk has. The python script that use gui doesn't work.
